alert.note: Alert for South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:20PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pinal County through 900 PM MST... At 818 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kearny, or near Hayden, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Wind gusts may proceed the rain by up to 30 minutes and cross State Route 79. Locations impacted include... Kearny, Dudleyville, Cactus Forest and Kelvin. This includes the following highways... Route 77 between mile markers 131 and 134. Route 79 between mile markers 113 and 128. Route 177 between mile markers 139 and 158. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: South Central Pinal County including Eloy, Picacho Peak State Park; Southeast Pinal County including Kearny, Mammoth, Oracle
